columns.text: For this exercise, we need to find the profit margin of Prince Albert Canning PLC. We also want to know if the fact that the currency affects the calculations of this indicator and what is the net loss in dollars.

We know the following information:
|||
|--|--|
Net loss (in £) |29,157
Sales (in £) |315,650
Sales (in $)| 395,183

First, we are going to calculate the profit margin using the formula for this ratio.

$$ \begin{aligned}
\text{Profit margin} & = \frac{\text{Net (income/loss)}}{\text{Sales}}\\
\\
\text{Profit margin} & = \frac{-£29,157}{£315,650}\\
& = \boxed{-0.092}
\end{aligned}$$

We can see that the profit margin is negative because the company has net loss instead of income.

To answer the question of whether the currency affects it or not, we can say without a doubt that it does not. The reason why is because we can see that all values are expressed in the same currency and the end result is a ratio or proportion value.

Finally, we want to calculate the net loss in USD if we know that the sales in USD were $395,183. For that, we are going to use the same formula that we use earlier and rearrange it to obtain our desired value. 

$$ \begin{aligned}
\text{Profit margin} & = \frac{\text{Net (income/loss)}}{\text{Sales}}\\
\\
\text{Net (income/loss)} & = {\text{Sales}}\cdot\text{Profit margin}\\

\end{aligned}$$

textbook.authors: Bradford D. Jordan, Randolph W. Westerfield, Stephen A. Ross
